isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - DISASSEMBLE - MAIN DIFFERENTIAL CASE AND RING GEAR

svcproc.title: MAIN DIFFERENTIAL CASE AND RING GEAR

step1.para: If the alignment marks on the case halves are not visible, use a punch and a hammer to mark the case halves. The alignment marks permit correct assembly and alignment of the case halves ( Figure 53).
Remove the bolts and the washers that fasten the halves of the main differential together.
Remove the spider, the pinions, the thrust washers and the side gears from the case halves ( Figure 54).

figure.caption: Figure 54. Remove Spider, Pinions, Thrust Washers, and Side Gears

step1.para: If the ring gear needs to be replaced, see the following procedure.

step2.para: On 145 and 160 Series axles, remove the bolts, washers and nuts that fasten the ring gear to the differential case.

caution.para: Do not remove the rivets or the rivet heads with a chisel and hammer. They can damage the differential case ( Figure 55).

figure.caption: Figure 55. Do Not Remove Rivets With Chisel and Hammer

step2.para: On 140 Series axles, remove the rivets that fasten the ring gear to the differential case. Use the following procedure:

step3.para: Carefully center-punch each rivet head in the center on the ring gear side of the assembly.

Drill each rivet head on the ring gear side of the assembly to a depth equal to the thickness of one rivet head. Use a drift bit that is .0312 inch (0.8 mm) smaller than the body diameter of the rivets ( Figure 55).
Press the rivets through the holes in the ring gear and the differential case. Press on the drilled rivet head.

step2.para: Put the ring gear and case assembly on a press so that the teeth of the gear are toward you. Put supports under the gear. Put a sleeve or a flat metal plate on top of the case. Press the main differential case from the ring gear ( Figure 56).

figure.caption: Figure 56. Press Main Differential Case From Ring Gear
